method.name: FuzzyApriori

reference.ref: Hong,T.-P., Kuo, C.-S., Chi, S.-C. Trade-off between computation time and number off rules for fuzzy mining from quantitative data. World Scientific Publishing Company, 587-604 (2001).

generalDescription.type: Association Rules Mining by means of Fuzzy Learning Methods
generalDescription.objective: The fuzzy learning methods proposed by Hong et al. is conceived for mining fuzzy association rules.
generalDescription.howWork: The fuzzy mining algorithm first transform each quantitative value into a fuzzy set of linguistic terms using a given set of membership functions. The algorithm then calculates the scalar cardinality of each linguistic term on all the transaction data. The mining process based on fuzzy counts is then performed to find fuzzy association rules.

parameterSpec.param: Number of Fuzzy Regions for Numeric Attributes: The number of fuzzy regions with which numeric attributes are evaluated.
Use Max Operator for 1-Frequent Itemsets: It indicates whether the max operator must be used while discovering 1-Frequent Itemsets.
Minimum Support: The user-specified minimum support for the mined association rules.
Minimum Confidence: The user-specified minimum confidence for the mined association rules.

method.example:
Problem type: Association Rules Method: FuzzyApriori Dataset: weather Parameters: default values
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see XML representations of the mined association rules along with the values concerning the measures of interest, respectively, in:
"results/Asso-FuzzyApri.weather/result0s0.tra"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rules> <rule id="0"> <antecedents> <attribute name="outlook" value="overcast"/> </antecedents> <consequents> <attribute name="play" value="yes"/> </consequents> </rule> </rules>
"results/Asso-FuzzyApri.weather/result0s0.tst"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <values n_one_frequent_itemsets="12" n_rules="52"> <rule id="0" rule_support="0.2857142857142857" antecedent_support="0.2857142857142857" confidence="1.0"/> </values>
We can also see some relevant information on-screen:
Reading the transaction set: ../datasets/weather/weather.dat Opening the file: ../datasets/weather/weather.dat. Processing inputs and outputs The number of output attributes is: 1
Reading the data Number of instances read: 14
Finishing the statistics: (isTrain)true, (# out attributes)1 File LOADED CORRECTLY!!
Pass: 1; Total Frequent Itemsets: 12 Pass: 2; Total Frequent Itemsets: 59; Total Association Rules: 3 Pass: 3; Total Frequent Itemsets: 98; Total Association Rules: 35 Pass: 4; Total Frequent Itemsets: 104; Total Association Rules: 52 Pass: 5; Total Frequent Itemsets: 104; Total Association Rules: 52
Number of Frequent Itemsets found: 104 Number of Association Rules generated: 52 Average Support: 0.16346153846153857 Average Confidence: 0.9972527472527474 Average Antecedents Length: 2.269230769230769 Number of Covered Records (%): 100.0
